author: Staff Reporter
text:
Special care has been taken to motivate tribal people from more than 200 villages on the hills in four Assembly constituencies in the district to cast their votes without fail, according to Collector N. Venkatachalam.

Inspecting the arrangements made at a polling station at Manalar in Highwavys town panchayat on Megamalai hills near here on Monday, he said that special teams had been deputed at tribal villages to enlighten them on the importance of voting and their democratic right. They distributed pamphlets, conducted road shows and performed cultural programmes to draw the attention of the tribal people and motivate them to cast their votes, he added.

Besides, a door-to-door campaign was also intensified at remote villages. All arrangements would be made in these villages to enable them to come to polling station and cast their votes. All departments were advised to provide facilities in these centres. The main objective was to achieve cent per cent polling in the Assembly election.Later, the Collector inspected basic amenities and facilities provided at the polling stations in the town panchayat.
